title: Five Resident Evil games tested on PS5 Pro - and the upgrades are substantial
description: Between all of the PS5 Pro upgrades we've tested to date, the Resident Evil series enjoys some of the greatest benefits by running on Sony's new hardware. In order, we have 2017's Resident Evil 7, the remakes for RE 2 and 3, Resident Evil Village, and most recently Resident Evil 4 Remake. Capcom's in-house RE Engine forms the technical backbone for all five games, of course, and each one runs as a native PS5 app. Except, there's often been a catch to their performance delivery on base PS5 - whether it's using RT features at 60fps in some cases, or enabling a 120Hz HFR mode in others, there's potential not being totally fulfilled on base hardware. PS5 Pro offers a solution across the board with its increased GPU power and more advanced PSSR upscaling, via which there's now a genuine means to bridge the gap to those frame-rate targets. Read more
author: Thomas Morgan

title: GOG's Winter Sale Is Now Live, Save On Over 6,500 PC Games
description: GOG has kicked off its annual Winter Sale, and with discounts on over 6,500 games, there are quite a few tempting deals here, including a long list of classic PC titles that you'll only find at GOG--though there are plenty of big discounts on many of the latest releases as well. The GOG Winter Sale lasts until January 3, 2025. See all Winter Sale deals at GOG As part of the sale, GOG is offering free games and other downloadable content daily until December 31. Right now, you can grab the adventure game The Whispered World for the low price of absolutely nothing until December 15. You can also download a set of seasonal desktop wallpapers. These deals will only be available for a limited time, so check back each day to see what's new.As for what's discounted in the GOG Winter Sale, there are many great classic games available for $5 or less, including Dragon Age Origins, Stalker: Shadow of Chernobyl, System Shock 2, and more. If you're playing the recently released Soul Reaver 1+2 Remaster and want to finish out Raziel's trilogy, be sure to grab Legacy of Kain: Defiance while it's on sale for less than $1.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Best Buy Weekend Doorbuster Deals - 65-Inch 4K TV For $320, Laptops For 40% Off, And More
description: Best Buy is running a 3-Day Sale that ends on Sunday, and a handful of doorbuster deals are dropping select products to some of their best prices of the year. The AirPods Max, for example, is seeing a generous $170 discount and comes with free three-month subscriptions to Apple Fitness+ and Apple Music. The headliner might be the TCL 65-Inch 4K QLED Smart TV, as the budget-friendly TV is on sale for the extremely low price of $320 (was $550). Browse 3-Day Sale at Best Buy Best Buy Doorbuster DealsTCL 65-Inch Class Q5-Series 4K QLED Smart TV -- $320 ($550)Samsung 75-Inch Class DU6950 4K UHD Smart TV + Free 32-Inch HD LED TV -- $550 ($750)HP OmniBook X 14-Inch Touchscreen Laptop (Snapdragon X Plus, 16GB RAM, 512GB SSD) -- $550 ($900)HP Envy 2-in-1 Touchscreen Laptop (AMD Ryzen 7, 16GB RAM, 1TB SSD) -- $600 ($1,050)Apple AirPods Max -- $380 ($550)Ninja Foodi 10-in-1 Smart XL Air Fryer Oven -- $130 ($330)The TCL 65-Inch Class Q5-Series 4K QLED Smart TV is a frugal way to upgrade your home theater, as it’s packed with some decent technology despite its low price. Beyond its 4K resolution, it offers HDR Pro+ with Dolby Vision, a 60Hz refresh rate, and an Auto Game Mode to automatically adjust your settings for the lowest possible input lag. It’s a good-looking TV too, with a metal bezel-less design that maximizes its screen space. TCL 65-Inch Class Q5-Series 4K QLED Smart TVGallery Need something to fill a larger room? Step up to the Samsung 75-Inch Class DU6950 Series 4K UHD Smart TV, as it’s discounted to $550 (was $750). It benefits from a large 4K display, support for HDR 10+, a 60Hz refresh rate, and 4K upscaling. This deal also comes with a free 32-inch Samsung LED TV valued at $230.Continue Reading at GameSpot

description: Lore has always been a tricky subject for fans when it comes to adaptations: Too close an adherence to the original text, and you get a diminished version of the thing you already love; too loose an adaptation, and suddenly your beloved series is unrecognizable. I’m fairly outspoken about my belief that as far as […]

title: Open world sword-swinger Crimson Desert horse-powerslides to a late 2025 release
description: Crimson Desert first galloped onto the scene in 2020, with a bombastic trailer at Gamescom 2023 showcasing some particularly beautiful medieval open world action adventuring. It's got horses, fishing, plate armour and roving heroism, but one thing it lacks is a release date. Now, thanks to The Geoff Awards, that's changed! Well, sort of - Crimson Desert is out sometime in late 2025. Read more
author: Ed Thorn

title: While CEOs got dressed up for the Game Awards, 461 workers at Zenimax Online Studios unionised
description: Stealth launching a game during an awards ceremony is cool. But you know what's cooler? Stealth launching a union. As many in the games industry settled in for an evening of advertisements and blockbuster backslapping, one group of US workers quietly succeeded in organising something of their own. Employees at Zenimax Online Studios launched their union with 461 members, as announced on social media site Bluesky last night. Read more
author: Brendan Caldwell

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 860
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Where would you rather go on vacation: New Zealand, Alaska, Costa Rica or Switzerland? I’d love to go to all of these places, but right now Switzerland sounds pretty cool. 2. Ponytail or curls? Hmm. I like ponytails because they’re functional, but sometimes they give me a headache, so let’s go with curls. They’d have to be super loose ones, though. And kinda messy! 3. Did you ever have a job where you had to wear a uniform? Kinda. We had very specific guidelines for safety when I worked at the bakery, like close-toed shoes, no nail polish, hair tied back. 4. If you were in school, whom would you likely hang out with: the athletes, the drama crew, the band kids or the honors society? You’d[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 860 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 841
description: Seasons greetings! Hard to believe we’re in full-on Christmas season time now, isn’t it? Folks getting their tree (we did today!), putting up the Christmas lights (workin’ on it!), other decorations. I was looking back at December posts over the years, and when I came upon this one it made me smile. 🙂 Mt. Saint Tabby? That was SO Tabs. It was a quiet morning on our hill today. Nothing really exciting happened, except for some joggers running by, which made a certain someone’s tail poof up… While Tabs checked out the usual blades of grass, plants and trees, I spent some time thinking about how possessive and jealous Tabs gets now in his older age. And not just with his humans. He’s also like that with his domain outside. I may or may not have received a Post-It last week asking me to write the city about renaming our hill, “Mt. Saint Tabby,” because Tabs doesn’t like the thought of anybody, and by “anybody,” I mean any other cats, chilling on his hill. Your[Continue reading...] The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 841 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen
